posts._title: Petr Kazda & Tomás Weinreb – Já, Olga Hepnarová AKA I, Olga Hepnarova (2016)
posts.title: Já, Olga Hepnarová
posts.excerpt: Olga Hepnarova was a young, lonely lesbian outsider from a coldhearted family who couldn’t play the part society had chosen for her. Her paranoid self-examination and inability to connect with other people eventually drove her over the edge of humanity when she was only 22 years old. The film shows the human being behind the …

posts.excerpt: Synopsis: Two sisters live with their father. The younger sister is embroiled in an affair and becomes pregnant. posts.title: In weiter Ferne, so nah!
posts.excerpt: Quote: In Faraway, So Close! angels watch over the people of Berlin. The world weighs heavily upon these men and women. Their attachment to things diminishes their desire for the invisible. posts.title: #Beings
posts.excerpt: Beings is the second feature film of Stefanescu Andrei, after Sleep Awake in 2012, is also a micro-budget film, this time shot in Berlin with a small magical crew in the autumn of 2014. It is a contemplative film about Eva a girl that leaves everything behind, a deep friendship with her friend Anna and …

posts.title: Unbranded
posts.excerpt: Sixteen mustangs, four men, one dream: to ride border to border, Mexico to Canada, up the spine of the American West. The documentary tracks four fresh-out-of-college buddies as they take on wild mustangs to be their trusted mounts, and set out on the adventure of a lifetime. Their wildness of spirit, in both man and …

posts._title: Bryony Dixon, Jane Giles, Becci Jones – Play On! Shakespeare in Silent Film (2016)
posts.title: Play On! Shakespeare in Silent Film
posts.excerpt: From King John in 1899, film adaptations of Shakespeare’s plays proved popular with early filmmakers and audiences. By the end of the silent era, around 300 films had been produced. This feature-length celebration draws together a delightful selection of thrilling, dramatic, iconic and humorous scenes from two dozen different titles, many of which have been …
